str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The Twelve Tribes (of Israel). From dodeka and phule; the commonwealth of Israel.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To hope, hope for, expect, trust. From elpis; to expect or confide.
From kata and a derivative of anti; to meet against, i.e. Arrive at.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: To serve, especially God, perhaps simply: I worship. From latris; to minister, i.e. Render religious homage.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
The night, night-time. A primary word; 'night'.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Feminine Singular

str2: Hope, expectation, trust, confidence. From a primary elpo; expectation or confidence.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To bring a charge against, accuse. From en and kaleo; to call in, i.e. Bring to account.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
